Comment: The basic problem, besides the dubious quality of the data these guys are presenting (who are their control subjects??), is that pregnancy itself is risky.¬†   Sometimes you miscarry naturally and sometimes THAT leads to hemorrhage or sepsis. It's a risk when your body has trouble expelling the tissue after the pregnancy is no longer viable. This can also happen sometimes with a medication abortion. This is why we need it to be legal, so doctors can monitor and treat things if the medication doesn't completely work. If the patient is afraid to go to the doctor they are at MUCH higher risk. Overall the medications is still fairly safe, though it would be safer still to just not be pregnant in the first place.¬†   But¬† of course, if these anti abortion people were actually trying to protect women's lives, they wouldn't have outlawed treating women when their pregnancies are failing until the women are on deaths door, now would they?¬†
